course_outcomes: Solve the system of homogeneous and non-homogeneous linear equations
Examine the nature of a quadratic form by transforming into a canonical form
Determine maxima and minima of multivariable functions
Evaluate areas and volumes using double, triple integrals

syllabus.title: Matrices
syllabus.topics: Rank of a matrix by Echelon form, Normal form, Cauchy–Binet formulae (without proof), Inverse of Non- singular matrices by Gauss-Jordan method, System of linear equations: Solving system of Homogeneous and Non-Homogeneous equations by Gauss elimination method, Jacobi and Gauss-Seidel Iteration Methods.

syllabus.title: Eigenvalues, Eigenvectors and Orthogonal Transformation
syllabus.topics: Eigenvalues, Eigenvectors and their properties, Diagonalization of a matrix, Cayley Hamilton Theorem (without proof), Finding inverse and power of a matrix by Cayley Hamilton Theorem, Quadratic forms and Nature of the Quadratic forms, Reduction of Quadratic form to Canonical forms by Orthogonal Transformation.

syllabus.title: Differential Calculus
syllabus.topics: Mean Value Theorems: Rolle’s theorem, Lagrange’s mean value theorem with their geometrical interpretation, Cauchy’s mean value theorem, Taylor’s and Maclaurin’s theorems with remainders (without proof), Problems and applications on the above theorems. Functions of Several Variables: Continuity and Differentiability, Partial derivatives, Total derivatives, Chain rule, Directional derivative, Taylor’s and Maclaurin’s series expansion of functions of two variables, Jacobians, Functional dependence, Maxima and Minima of functions of two variables, Method of Lagrange multipliers.

syllabus.title: Multiple Integrals (Multivariable Calculus)
syllabus.topics: Double integrals,Triple integrals, Change of order of integration, Change of variables to polar, cylindrical and spherical coordinates, Finding areas (by double integrals) and volumes (by double integrals and triple integrals).

textbooks: Higher Engineering Mathematics, B. S. Grewal, Khanna Publishers, 2017, 44th Edition
reference_books: Advanced Engineering Mathematics, Erwin Kreyszig, John Wiley & Sons, 2018, 10th Edition.
Thomas Calculus, George B. Thomas, Maurice D. Weir and Joel Hass, Pearson Publishers, 2018,14th Edition
Advanced Engineering Mathematics, R. K. Jain and S. R. K. Iyengar, Alpha Science International Ltd., 2021 5th Edition(9th reprint)
Advanced Modern Engineering Mathematics, Glyn James, Pearson publishers, 2018, 5th Edition
Advanced Engineering Mathematics, Micheael Greenberg, , Pearson publishers, 9th Edition
Higher Engineering Mathematics, H. K Das, Er. Rajnish Verma, S. Chand Publications,2014, 3rd Edition (Reprint 2021)

course_outcomes: Elaborate different types of lasers, optical fibers and their applications
Familiarize with the basics of crystals and their structures
Summarize various types of polarization of dielectrics and classify the magnetic materials
Explain the basic concepts of Quantum Mechanics and types of semiconductors using Hall Effect.

syllabus.title: Lasers and Fiber Optics
syllabus.topics: Lasers: Introduction, Characteristics of laser, Basic Principles of lasers, Requirements of lasers, Einstein’s coefficients, different types of lasers: solid-state lasers (Ruby), gas lasers, (He-Ne), Semiconductor laser, applications. Fibre Optics: Introduction, Fundamentals of optic fibre, Propagation of light through optical fiber, Types of optical fibers, Numerical aperture, Fractional Refractive Index change, Fiber optics in communication.

syllabus.title: Crystallography and X-ray diffraction
syllabus.topics: Crystallography: Space lattice, Basis, Unit Cell and lattice parameters, Bravais Lattices, crystal systems (3D), coordination number- packing fraction of SC, BCC, FCC- Miller indices. X-ray diffraction: Bragg’s law- X-ray Diffractometer, crystal structure determination by Laue’s and powder methods.

syllabus.title: Dielectric and Magnetic Materials
syllabus.topics: Dielectric Materials: Introduction- Dielectric polarization- Dielectric polarizability, Susceptibility, Dielectric constant. Types of polarizations- Electronic, Ionic and Orientation polarizations. Lorentz internal field- Clausius- Mossotti equation. Magnetic Materials: Introduction- Magnetic dipole moment- Magnetization-Magnetic susceptibility and permeability – Atomic origin of magnetism- Classification of magnetic materials, Domain concept, Hysteresis.

syllabus.title: Quantum Mechanics and Semiconductors
syllabus.topics: Quantum Mechanics: Dual nature of light, Matter waves, Debroglie’s hypothesis, Heisenberg’s Uncertainty Principle, Schrodinger’s wave equations, Particle in a one-dimensional infinite potential well. Semiconductors: Formation of energy bands, Intrinsic and Extrinsic semiconductors, Fermi level, Drift and diffusion currents, Einstein’s equation, Hall effect, Photodiode, LED, Solar cell.

textbooks: A Text book of Engineering Physics, M. N. Avadhanulu, P.G.Kshirsagar & TVS Arun Murthy, S. Chand Publications, 11th Edition 2019.
Engineering Physics - D.K.Bhattacharya and Poonam Tandon, Oxford press (2015)
reference_books: Engineering Physics - B.K. Pandey and S. Chaturvedi, Cengage Learning 2021.
Engineering Physics - Shatendra Sharma, Jyotsna Sharma, Pearson Education, 2018.
Engineering Physics - Sanjay D. Jain, D. Sahasrabudhe and Girish, University Press. 2010
Engineering Physics - M.R. Srinivasan, New Age international publishers (2009).

course_outcomes: Understand various Civil Engineering sub-divisions, their role in society, basic building components, Civil Engineering Materials, and prefabricated technology.
Know the basic concepts of surveying, the importance of Transportation, and the significance of Water Storage and Conveyance Structures.
Understand the scope of Mechanical Engineering in different sectors and know about different manufacturing processes.
Explain the basics of thermal engineering, Power plants, power transmission, and robotics.

syllabus.title: Basics of Civil Engineering
syllabus.topics: Role of Civil Engineers, Various Disciplines of Civil Engineering, Building Construction and Planning, Construction Materials (Cement, Aggregate, Bricks, Concrete, Steel), Prefabricated Construction Techniques.

syllabus.title: Surveying, Transportation, and Water Resources
syllabus.topics: Objectives and Principles of Surveying, Importance of Transportation, components of Roads, Classification of Highways. Water Resources: Sources, Quality, Dams and Reservoirs.

syllabus.title: Introduction to Mechanical Engineering
syllabus.topics: Role of Mechanical Engineering, Technologies in Energy, Manufacturing, Automotive, Aerospace, and Marine sectors. Engineering Materials. Manufacturing Processes: Casting, joining, Machining, CNC machines, 3D printing, Smart manufacturing.

syllabus.title: Thermal Engineering and Power Transmission
syllabus.topics: IC engines (2-Stroke, 4-Stroke), SI/CI Engines, Otto and Diesel cycles, Electric and Hybrid Vehicles, Refrigeration and air conditioning, Boilers, Power plants (Steam, Nuclear). Mechanical Power Transmission: Belt and Gear Drives, Robotics.

textbooks: Basic Civil Engineering, M.S.Palanisamy, Tata Mcgraw Hill publications (India) Pvt. Ltd. Fourth Edition.
Internal Combustion Engines by V.Ganesan, By Tata McGraw Hill publications (India) Pvt. Ltd.
A text book of Theory of Machines by S.S. Rattan, Tata McGraw Hill Publications, (India) Pvt. Ltd.
reference_books: Surveying, Vol- I and Vol-II, S.K. Duggal, Tata McGraw Hill Publishers 2019.
G. Shanmugam and M.S.Palanisamy, Basic Civil and the Mechanical Engineering, Tata McGraw Hill publications (India) Pvt. Ltd.

course_outcomes: To introduce students to the fundamentals of computer programming.
To provide hands-on experience with coding and debugging on control structures and arrays.
To foster logical thinking and problem-solving skills on strings and pointers.
To familiarize students with programming concepts such as functions, structures and files.

syllabus.title: Introduction to Programming and Problem Solving
syllabus.topics: History of Computers, Basic organization of a computer, Introduction to Programming Languages, Algorithms, flowcharts, pseudo code. Compilation and Execution, Primitive Data Types, Variables, Constants, Basic I/O, Operations, Type Conversion, and Casting. Problem solving strategies: Top-down, Bottom-up, Time and space complexities.

syllabus.title: Control Structures and Arrays
syllabus.topics: Conditional Statements (if, if-else, switch), Loops (for, while, do- while), Break and Continue, Arrays, two dimensional arrays.

syllabus.title: Strings and pointers
syllabus.topics: Introduction to Strings. Pointers, dereferencing and address operators, pointer and address arithmetic, array manipulation using pointers.

syllabus.title: Functions, User Defined Data types and File Handling
syllabus.topics: Introduction to Functions, Function Declaration and Definition, Function call, Return Types and Arguments, arrays as parameters. Scope and Lifetime of Variables, User-defined data types-Structures and Unions, Basics of File Handling.

textbooks: The C Programming Language, Brian W. Kernighan and Dennis M. Ritchie, Prentice- Hall, 1988
Schaum’s Outline of Programming with C, Byron S Gottfried, McGraw-Hill Education, 1996.
reference_books: Computing fundamentals and C Programming, Balagurusamy, E., McGraw-Hill Education, 2008.
Programming in C, Rema Theraja, Oxford, 2016, 2nd edition.

metadata.prerequisites: Basic understanding of the language skills
course_outcomes: Understand the context, topic, and pieces of specific information from dialogues.
Apply grammatical structures to formulate sentences and correct word forms.
Analyze discourse markers to speak clearly on a specific topic.
Evaluate reading texts to write summaries and create coherent paragraphs, essays, and resumes.

syllabus.title: Human Values
syllabus.topics: Lesson: Gift of Magi (Short Story). Skills: Listening, Speaking, Reading, Writing. Grammar: Parts of Speech. Vocabulary: Synonyms, Antonyms, Affixes.

syllabus.title: Nature
syllabus.topics: Lesson: The Brook by Alfred Tennyson (Poem). Skills: Group discussions, identifying idea sequences. Grammar: Cohesive devices, articles, prepositions. Vocabulary: Homonyms, Homophones.

syllabus.title: Biography
syllabus.topics: Lesson: Elon Musk. Skills: Summarizing, Note-making, Essay Writing. Grammar: Tenses, subject-verb agreement. Vocabulary: Compound words, Collocations.

syllabus.title: Inspiration
syllabus.topics: Lesson: The Toys of Peace by Saki. Skills: Role plays, interpreting graphics. Writing: Letter Writing, Resumes, Reports. Grammar: Reporting verbs, Direct/Indirect speech, Active/Passive Voice.

textbooks: Pathfinder: Communicative English for Undergraduate Students, 1st Edition, Orient Black Swan, 2023
Empowering with Language by Cengage Publications, 2023
English: Language, Context and Culture, 1st Edition, Orient Black Swan, 2023
reference_books: Dubey, Sham Ji & Co. English for Engineers, Vikas Publishers, 2020.
Bailey, Stephen. Academic writing: A Handbook for International Students. Routledge, 2014.
Murphy, Raymond. English Grammar in Use, Fourth Edition, Cambridge University Press, 2019.

course_outcomes: Test optical components using principles of interference and diffraction of light.
Use spectrometer, travelling microscope and function generator in various experiments.
Determine the V-I characteristics of photo cells and appreciate the accuracy in measurements.

syllabus.title: List of Experiments
topics: Determination of radius of curvature by Newton’s rings.
Study the variation of B versus H (B-H curve).
Determination of wavelength of Laser light using diffraction grating.
Estimation of stopping potential and work function using photoelectric effect.
Magnetic field along the axis of a current carrying circular coil.
Determination of Hall voltage and Hall coefficient.
Determination of Acceleration due to Gravity using a compound pendulum.
Sonometer: Verification of laws of stretched string.
Determination of Dielectric constant.
Determination of Numerical Aperture of an optical fiber.
Determination of Frequency by Melde’s experiment.
Determination of Rigidity Modulus using Torsional pendulum.
Determination of wavelengths using diffraction grating.
Determination of Energy Gap of a semiconductor.
Determination of thickness of a thin foil by Wedge Method.
Estimation of Fill Factor of a Solar Cell.
Study of LCR Circuit.
Determination of Figure of merit of a Galvanometer.

textbooks: MadhusudhanRao, “Engineering Physics Lab Manual”, Isted.,Scitech Publications,2015.
RamaraoSri,Choudary Nityanand and Prasad Daruka, ”Lab Manual of Engineering Physics”.,Vthed.,Excell Books,2010.

course_outcomes: Read, understand, and trace the execution of programs written in C language.
Select the right control structure for solving the problem.
Develop C programs which utilize memory efficiently using programming constructs like pointers.
Develop, Debug and Execute programs to demonstrate the applications of arrays, functions, basic concepts of pointers in C.

syllabus.title: List of Experiments
syllabus.topics: Familiarization with programming environment, Problem-solving using Algorithms and Flow charts, Simple computational problems using arithmetic expressions, Problems involving if-then-else structures, Iterative problems, 1D Array manipulation and linear search, Matrix problems, String operations, Bubble sort, Pointers and structures, memory dereference, Bitfields, linked lists, Simple functions using call by value, Recursive functions, Call by reference, File operations.

course_outcomes: Understand the different aspects of the English language proficiency with emphasis on LSRW skills.
Apply communication skills through various language learning activities.
Analyze the English speech sounds, stress, rhythm, intonation and syllable division for better listening and speaking comprehension.
Evaluate and exhibit professionalism in participating in debates and group discussions.

syllabus.title: List of Topics
topics: Vowels and Consonants
Neutralization/Accent Rules
Communication Skills & JAM
Role Play or Conversational Practice
E-mail Writing
Resume Writing, Cover Letter, SOP
Group Discussions-methods & practice
Debates– Methods & Practice
PPT Presentations/Poster Presentations
Interview Skills

course_outcomes: Understand the basic joints using wood and familiarize with various fundamental aspects of house wiring, fitting and foundry.
Prepare basic models using sheet metal and practice joining of metals using various types of welding.
Familiarize with various advanced manufacturing processes such as injection moulding and 3D printing.
Understand the preparation of PCB and simple IOT applications using Arduino.

syllabus.title: List of Trades
syllabus.topics: Demonstration on Safety practices. Wood Working, Sheet Metal Working, Fitting, Electrical Wiring, Foundry Trade, Welding Shop, Advanced manufacturing processes (injection moulding and 3D printing), Electronic Circuits (PCB), Basic IOT (Arduino).

textbooks: Basic Workshop Technology: Manufacturing Process, Felix W.; Independently Published,2019.

Wiring Estimating, Costing and Contracting; Soni P.M. &Upadhyay P.A.; AtulPrakashan, 2021-22.

course_outcomes: Perform Hardware troubleshooting.
Understand Hardware components and inter dependencies.
Safeguard computer systems from viruses/worms.
Document/ Presentation preparation.
Perform calculations using spreadsheets.

Internet & World Wide Web (Configure TCP/IP, Web Browsers, Search Engines, Cyber Hygiene). LaTeX and WORD (Create documents, formatting, tables). EXCEL (Create Scheduler, Calculate GPA). POWER POINT (Create presentations, layouts, objects). AI TOOLS – ChatGPT (Prompt Engineering, Creative Writing, Translation).

course_outcomes: Solve first order linear differential equations
Solve higher order linear differential equations with constant coefficients
Solve Partial differential equations
Evaluate the work done against field, circulation and flux using vector calculus

syllabus.title: Differential equations of first order and first degree
syllabus.topics: Linear differential equations– Bernoulli’s equations- Exact equations and equations reducible to exact form, Applications: Newton’s Law of cooling– Law of natural growth and decay- Electrical circuits.

syllabus.title: Linear differential equations of higher order (Constant Coefficients)
syllabus.topics: Definitions,homogenous and non-homogenous, complimentary function, general solution, particular integral, Wronskian, Method of variation of parameters, Simultaneous linear equations, Applications to L-C-R Circuit problems and Simple Harmonic motion.

syllabus.title: Partial Differential Equations
syllabus.topics: Introduction and formation of Partial Differential Equations by elimination of arbitrary constants and arbitrary functions, solutions of first order linear equations using Lagrange’s method, Homogeneous Linear Partial differential equations with constant coefficients.

syllabus.title: Vector Calculus
syllabus.topics: Scalar and vector point functions, vector operator Del, Del applies to scalar point functions- Gradient, Directional derivative, del applied to vector point functions Divergence and Curl, vector identities. Line integral-circulation-work done, surface integral-flux, Green’s theorem in the plane, Stoke’s theorem, volume integral, Divergence theorem.

textbooks: Higher Engineering Mathematics, B. S. Grewal, Khanna Publishers, 2017, 44th Edition

course_outcomes: Apply the principles of quantum mechanics for determining structure and bonding of molecules
Apply the principles electrochemistry for its applications in chemical analysis, electrodes, electrochemical sensors and energy sources
Explain the mechanistic aspects of polymerisation and conduction, types, preparation, properties and applications of polymers
Compare different spectroscopic and chromatographic techniques for their application in qualitative and quantitative analysis
Choose engineering materials including nanomaterials based on their properties for their applications in various industrial fields

syllabus.title: Structure and Bonding Models & Engineering Materials
syllabus.topics: Fundamentals of Quantum mechanics, Schrodinger wave equation, Molecular orbital theory, bonding in homo and heteronuclear diatomic molecules. Engineering Materials: Semiconductors, Superconductors, Supercapacitors.

syllabus.title: Electrochemistry & Electrochemical Energy Systems
syllabus.topics: Electrochemical cell, Nernst equation, potentiometry, concept of conductivity, conductometric titrations, Electrochemical sensors. Electrochemical Energy Systems: Primary cells, Secondary cells, Fuel cells.

syllabus.title: Polymer Chemistry
syllabus.topics: Introduction to polymers, functionality of monomers, addition and condensation polymerization. Plastics, Elastomers. Conducting Polymers, Biodegradable polymers.

syllabus.title: Instrumental Methods of Analysis & Nano materials
syllabus.topics: Electromagnetic spectrum, UV Visible Spectroscopy, IR spectroscopy, Chromatography. Nano materials: Introduction, classification, Properties and applications of fullerenes, carbon nanotubes, graphene and nanoparticles.

textbooks: Engineering Chemistry, Jain and Jain, 17th Edition, DhanpatRai, 2018.
Engineering Chemistry, PrasanthaRath S. ArunaKumari, Cengage Publishers, 2023.

course_outcomes: Apply different techniques to solve DC circuits
Understand the magnetic circuit concepts
Analyze the steady-state response, series, parallel AC circuits, mesh & nodal analysis, and resonance
Apply network theorems for AC & DC circuits
Demonstrate the working principles of basic Electronic devices, circuits and instrumentation System
Implementation of simple Combinational and Sequential circuits using Logic gates

syllabus.title: DC & AC Circuits
syllabus.topics: DC Circuits: Ohm’s Law, KCL & KVL, series, parallel circuits, Super Position theorem. AC Circuits: A.C. Fundamentals, phasor diagrams in R, L, and C circuits, Impedance, Power, Power factor. Equipment Safety Measures: Fuse, MCB. Personal safety measures: Electric Shock, Earthing.

syllabus.title: Machines and Measuring Instruments
syllabus.topics: Machines: DC Motor, DC Generator, Single Phase Transformer, Three Phase Induction Motor, Alternator. Measuring Instruments: Voltage, Current, temperature sensors, multimeter. Electricity bill calculation.

syllabus.title: Semiconductor Devices
syllabus.topics: PN Junction Diode, Zener Diode. Bipolar Junction Transistor, CB, CE, CC Configurations. Rectifiers and power supplies: full wave bridge rectifier, capacitor filter, zener voltage regulator. Amplifiers, Electronic Instrumentation.

syllabus.title: Digital Electronics
syllabus.topics: Number Systems, Logic gates, BCD codes, Excess-3 code, Gray code, Hamming code. Boolean Algebra. Simple combinational circuits–Half and Full Adders. Introduction to Flip flops, Registers and counters.

course_outcomes: Demonstrate the role of data structures in organizing and accessing data efficiently
Understand various techniques for searching, sorting and hashing algorithms
Demonstrate the operations on linear data structures like stack, queue and linked list
Analyze various operations on nonlinear data structures– binary tree, and binary search tree

syllabus.title: Basic Concepts, Searching and Sorting
syllabus.topics: Algorithm Specification, Data Abstraction, Performance Analysis. Searching: Linear Search and Binary Search. Sorting: Bubble Sort, Insertion Sort, Selection Sort.

syllabus.title: Linked Lists and Stacks
syllabus.topics: Linked lists, doubly linked lists, circularly linked lists. Stacks: Stack Model, Implementation of Stacks, Linked Stacks, Applications.

syllabus.title: Queues and Trees
syllabus.topics: Queues: Queue Model, Array implementation of Queues, Linked Queues, Circular Queues, Dequeues. Trees: Introduction, Binary Trees, Binary Tree traversals, Binary Search Tree.

syllabus.title: Graphs and Hashing
syllabus.topics: Graphs: Graph Abstract Datatype, Elementary Graph Operations- DFS, BFS. Hashing: General idea, Hash Functions, separate chaining, open addressing, rehashing, extendable hashing.

textbooks: BMark Allen Weiss , “Data Structures and algorithm analysis in C”, Pearson, 2nd Edition, 2016.
Ellis Horowitz, Sartaj Sahni, Susan Anderson-Freed , “Fundamentals of data structures in C”, University Press, 2020

course_outcomes: Understand the principles of engineering drawing, including engineering curves and scales
Draw and interpret orthographic projections of points, lines and planes
Understand and draw projection of solids and Development of Surfaces
Explain principles behind the Sections of solids, Prepare isometric views and conversion of simple solids

syllabus.title: Introduction to Drawing, Curves, and Scales
syllabus.topics: Lines, Lettering and Dimensioning, Geometrical Constructions. Curves: Construction of ellipse, parabola and hyperbola, Involutes. Scales: Plain scales and diagonal scales.

syllabus.title: Orthographic Projections
syllabus.topics: Projections of a point. Projections of Straight Lines. Projections of Planes.

syllabus.title: Projections of Solids and Development of Surfaces
syllabus.topics: Projections of solids (Prisms and Pyramids only). Development of Surfaces: Parallel line and radial line development.

syllabus.title: Sections of Solids, Isometric Views, and Conversion of Views
syllabus.topics: Sections of Solids. Isometric Views. Conversion of isometric views to orthographic views.

textbooks: N. D. Bhatt, Engineering Drawing, Charotar Publishing House, 2016.

course_outcomes: Understand various forms of organizations and principles of management
Understand the various aspects of business economics.
Perceive the knowledge on Human resources and Marketing functions
Evaluate various alternatives economically.

syllabus.title: Business Organization and Management
syllabus.topics: Forms of Business Organization: Salient Features of Sole Proprietorship, Partnership, Joint Stock Company, Co-operative Society and Public Sector. Management: Introduction to Management, Functions of Management, Principles of Scientific Management, Modern Principles of Management.

syllabus.title: Economics, Demand, and Supply Analysis
syllabus.topics: Introduction to Economics: Basic Economic Concepts, Utility Analysis: Marginal Utility and Total Utility, Law of Diminishing Marginal Utility, Law of Equi Marginal Utility. Demand Analysis: Theory of Demand, Factors Influencing Demand, Elasticity of Demand. Supply Analysis: Supply Schedule and Supply Curve, Factors Influencing Supply.

syllabus.title: Human Resource and Marketing Management
syllabus.topics: Human Resource Management: Meaning and difference between Personnel Management and Human Resource Management, Functions of Human Resource Management. Marketing Management: Concept of Selling And Marketing– Differences, Functions of Marketing, Product Life Cycle, Concept of Advertising, Sales Promotion, Types of Distribution Channels, Marketing Research, Break-Even Analysis.

syllabus.title: Financial Management and Economic Alternatives
syllabus.topics: Financial Management: Functions of Financial Management, Time value of money with cash flow diagrams, Concept of Simple and Compound Interest. Depreciation: Causes, common methods (Straight Line, Declining Balance, Sum of Year’s Digits). Economic Alternatives: Methods of Evaluating Alternatives under Present worth method, Future worth method, Annual Equivalent method.

Martand Telsang” Industrial & Business Management” S.Chand publications

course_outcomes: Understand and aware of themselves and their surroundings (family, society and nature).
Handle problems with sustainable solutions, while keeping human relationships and human nature in mind.
Exhibit critical ability and become sensitive to their commitment towards their understanding of human values, human relationship and human society.
Apply what they have learnt to their own self in different day-to-day settings in real life.

syllabus.title: Course Introduction and Basic Human Aspirations
syllabus.topics: Purpose and motivation for the course, recapitulation from UHV-I, Self-exploration: what is it?, its content and process, ‘Natural acceptance’ and experiential validation- as the process for self-exploration. Continuous Happiness and Prosperity – A look at basic Human Aspirations. Right understanding, Relationship and Physical Facility – the basic requirements for fulfillment of aspirations of every human being with their correct priority, Understanding Happiness and Prosperity correctly – A critical appraisal of the current scenario, Method to fulfill the above human aspirations: understanding and living in harmony at various levels.

syllabus.title: Understanding Harmony in the Human Being – Harmony in Myself
syllabus.topics: Understanding human being as a co-existence of the sentient ‘I’ and the material ‘Body’. Understanding the needs of Self (‘I’) and ‘Body’ – happiness and physical facility, Understanding the Body as an instrument of ‘I’ (I being the doer, seer and enjoyer). Understanding the characteristics and activities of ‘I’ and harmony in ‘I’. Understanding the harmony of I with the Body: Sanyam and Health; correct appraisal of Physical needs, meaning of Prosperity in detail, Programs to ensure Sanyam and Health.

syllabus.title: Understanding Harmony in the Family and Society – Harmony in Human-Human Relationship
syllabus.topics: Understanding values in human-human relationship; meaning of Justice (nine universal values in relationships) and program for its fulfillment to ensure mutual happiness; Trust and Respect as the foundational values of relationship, Understanding the meaning of Trust; Difference between intention and competence, Understanding the meaning of Respect, Difference between respect and differentiation; the other salient values in relationship. Understanding the harmony in the society (society being an extension of family); Resolution, Prosperity, fearlessness (trust) and co-existence as comprehensive Human Goals, Visualizing a universal harmonious order in society–Undivided Society, Universal Order–from family to world family.

syllabus.title: Understanding Harmony in Nature & Existence – Whole existence as Coexistence and Implications of the above Holistic Understanding of Harmony on Professional Ethics
syllabus.topics: Understanding the harmony in the Nature, Inter-connectedness and mutual fulfillment among the four orders of Nature – recyclability and self-regulation in nature, Understanding Existence as Co-existence of mutually interacting units in all-pervasive space, Holistic perception of harmony at all levels of existence. Natural acceptance of human values, Definitiveness of ethical human conduct, Basis for humanistic education, humanistic constitution and humanistic universal order, Competence in professional ethics, Case studies of typical holistic technologies, management models and production systems, Strategy for transition from the present state to Universal Human Order.

textbooks: A Foundation Course in Human Values and Professional Ethics, R. R. Gaur, R. Sangal and G. P. Bagaria, Excel Books Private Limited, New Delhi (2010).
reference_books: Jeevan Vidya: Ek Parichaya, A. Nagaraj, Jeevan Vidya Prakashan, Amarkantak (1999).
Human Values, A. N. Tripathi, New Age International Publishers, New Delhi (2004).
The Story of Stuff: The impact of overconsumption on the planet, our communities, and our health and how we can make it better, Annie Leonard, Free Press, New York (2010).

course_outcomes: Understand the digital logic design principles, register transfer operations, CPU & Memory organizations and Computer organization fundamentals.
Design the hardwired and micro-programmed control units.
Demonstrate the Fixed Point Arithmetic Operations and various Addressing Modes.
Analyze different ways of communication with I/O devices and standard I/O interfaces.

syllabus.title: Digital Logic and Basic Computer Structure
syllabus.topics: Digital Logic Circuits: Logic Gates, Boolean Algebra, Map Simplification, Combinational Circuits, Flip Flops, Sequential Circuits. Digital Components: Decoders, Multiplexers, Registers, Shift Registers, Binary Counters. Basic Structure of Computers: Computer Types, Functional Units, Basic Operational concepts, Software, Performance, Multiprocessors and Multi computers, Computer Generations.

syllabus.title: Register Transfer and Basic Computer Organization
syllabus.topics: Register Transfer and Micro-Operations: Register Transfer Language, Register Transfer, Bus and memory Transfers, Arithmetic Micro-operations, Logic Micro-operations, Shift Micro-operations, Arithmetic Logic Shift Unit. Basic Computer Organization and Design: Instruction codes, Computer Registers, Computer Instructions, Timing and Control, Instruction cycle, Memory-Reference Instruction, Input-Output and Interrupt.

syllabus.title: Micro Programmed Control and CPU
syllabus.topics: Micro Programmed Control: Control Memory, Address Sequencing, MicroProgram example, Design of Control Unit. Central Processing Unit: Introduction, General Register Organization, Stack Organization, Instruction Formats, Addressing Modes, Reduced Instruction Set Computer - CISC Characteristics, RISC Characteristics.

syllabus.title: Computer Arithmetic and Memory Organization
syllabus.topics: Computer Arithmetic: Addition and Subtraction, Multiplication Algorithms, Division Algorithms. Memory Organization: Memory Hierarchy, Associative Memory, Cache Memory. Input-Output Organization: Input-output Interface, Asynchronous Data Transfer, Modes of Transfer, Priority Interrupt, Direct Memory Access (DMA).

textbooks: M.Morris Mano, “Computer System Architecture, Revised Third Edition, Pearson publications, 2020.
Carl Hamacher, Zvonko Vranesic, Safwat Zaky, “Computer Organization”, Sixth Edition, McGraw Hill Publication, 2002.
reference_books: J.P.Hayes, “Computer Architecture and Organization” TMH, International Second Revised Edition, 1998
William Stallings, “Computer Organization and Architecture”, Ninth Edition, Pearson/PHI, 2013
Andrew S. Tanenbaum, “Structured Computer Organization”, Fifth Edition, PHI/Pearson, 2009

course_outcomes: Design an Algorithm and estimate the asymptotic performance of algorithms
Synthesize design techniques and choose appropriate technique to solve problems.
Analyze algorithm design techniques to provide optimal solution for given problem.
Understand various operations on advanced tree data structures and asymptotic performance of algorithms.

syllabus.title: Introduction to Algorithms and Divide and Conquer
syllabus.topics: What is an algorithm, Algorithm Specification: Pseudo code Conventions, Performance Analysis: Space Complexity, Time Complexity, Asymptotic Notation (Big ―oh, Omega, Theta, Little ―oh). Divide and Conquer: General method, Binary search, Finding the Maximum and Minimum, Merge sort, Quick sort, Strassen‘s matrix multiplication.

syllabus.title: Greedy Method and Dynamic Programming
syllabus.topics: Greedy method: General method, knapsack problem, Job Sequencing with deadlines, Minimum cost spanning trees: Prim‘s and Kruskal‘s algorithms, Single source shortest path problem. Dynamic Programming: General method, All pairs shortest Path problem, Single-source shortest paths: general weights, String Editing, 0/1 knapsack problem, Travelling salesperson problem.

syllabus.title: Backtracking and Branch and Bound
syllabus.topics: Backtracking: General method, 8-queens problem, sum of subsets, graph coloring, Hamiltonian cycles. Branch and Bound: The General method, 0/1knapsack problem, Travelling Salesperson Problem

syllabus.title: Advanced Data Structures and NP-Hard/Complete Problems
syllabus.topics: Trees: AVL trees: Creation, insertion and deletion operations and Applications. B-Trees: Creation, insertion and deletion operations and Applications. Splay Trees: A simple idea, splaying, Top-Down splay trees. Red-Black trees: Definition and Properties, Searching a Red-Black Tree, Top-Down Insertion, Bottom-Up Insertion, Deletion operations. Heap Trees(Priority queues): Min and Max Heaps, Operations and Applications. NP-Hard and NP-Complete problems: Basic concepts, non-deterministic algorithms, the classes NP Hard and NP Complete.

textbooks: Ellis Horowitz, Sartaj Sahni, Dinesh Mehta, “FUNDAMENTALS OF DATA STRUCTURES in C++”, 2nd edition, University Press.
Ellis. Horowitz, Sartaj Sahani, Sanguthevar Rajasekharan, “FUNDAMENTALS OF COMPUTER ALGORITHMS”, 2nd edition, University Press.
reference_books: Thomas H Cormen, Charles E Leiserson, Ronald L Rivest and Clifford Stein, “Introduction to Algorithms”, PHI learning Pvt.Ltd., New Delhi, 2010.
Lee, Kent D., Hubbard, Steve, “Data Structures and Algorithms with Python”, 1st edition, Springer International Publishing, 2015.

course_outcomes: Understand object-oriented programming principles to build classes and create objects
Analyze exception handling techniques to debug correctness and handle run time errors
Apply the knowledge of generics, collections and multi-threading to solve the problems
Demonstrate the knowledge of lambda expressions and stream API operations to solve the problems

syllabus.title: Introduction to Java and OOP
syllabus.topics: An Overview of java, Data types, variables and arrays. Classes and Objects: Class fundamentals, declaring objects, assigning object reference variables, introducing methods, constructors, this keyword, overloading methods, Understanding Static and Introducing final keywords. String handling: The string constructors, string tokenizer class.

syllabus.title: Inheritance, Packages, and Exception Handling
syllabus.topics: Inheritance: Inheritance basics, using super, creating a multilevel hierarchy, method overriding, dynamic method dispatch, using abstract classes, using final with inheritance. Packages & Interfaces: Defining a package, finding package and CLASSPATH, Packages and Member access, importing packages, Defining an interface, implementing interfaces, nested interfaces, applying interfaces, variables in interfaces. Exception handling: Exception handling fundamentals, exception types, uncaught exceptions, using try and catch, multiple catch clauses, throw, throws, finally, creating your own exception subclasses.

syllabus.title: Generics, Multithreading, and Collections
syllabus.topics: Generics: A Generic class with two type parameters, the general from of a generic class, Bounded types. Multithread Programming: The Java thread model, creating a thread, implementing runnable, extending thread, creating multiple threads, thread priorities. Collections Framework: Collections overview, the Collection interfaces: Collection, List and Set. Collection Classes: ArrayList, LinkedList, HashSet,TreeSet

syllabus.title: Lambda Expressions, Method References, and Stream API
syllabus.topics: Lambda Expressions: Lambda Expression fundamentals, function interfaces, some lambda expression examples, Block lambda expressions, Passing lambda expressions as arguments. Method References: Method References to static methods, Method References to instance methods, Method References with generics. Stream API: Stream Basics: Stream interfaces, how to obtaining a Stream, A simple Stream examples, Reduction Operations, Using Parallel Streams, Mapping, Collecting, Iterators and Stream.

textbooks: Herbert Schildt, “Java The Complete Reference”, 12th Edition, McGraw Hill, New Delhi, 2022.
Debasis Samanta, “Joy with JAVA, Fundamentals of Object-Oriented Programming”, Monalisa Sarma, Cambridge, 2023.
reference_books: Kathy Sierra & Bert Bates, Head First Java, Second edition, Shroff/O‘Reilly, 2009.
Berbert Schildt, Dale Skrien, “Java Fundamentals: A Comprehension Introduction”, Special Indian Edition, McGraw-Hill Education India Pvt. Ltd, 2013.
Paul J. Dietel and Dr.Harvey M. Deitel, “Java How to Program, 9th Edition, Prentice-Hall, Pearson Education, 2011.
Timothy Budd, “Understanding Object Oriented Programming with Java”, updated edition, Pearson Education, 2013.

course_outcomes: Think reason logically in any critical situation
Analyze given information to find correct solution
To reduce the mistakes in day to day activities in practical life
Develop time management skills by approaching different shortcut methods
Use mathematical based reasoning to make decisions
Apply logical thinking to solve problems and puzzles in qualifying exams for companies and in other competitive exams

syllabus.title: Analytical Reasoning
syllabus.topics: Series Completion, Coding-Decoding, Blood Relation, Puzzles test.

syllabus.title: Logical Reasoning
syllabus.topics: Direction sense test, Logical Venn diagrams, Number test, ranking test, Mathematical operations.

syllabus.title: Abstract Reasoning
syllabus.topics: Arithmetical Reasoning, Inserting missing character, Syllogism, Binary logic, Data sufficiency

syllabus.title: Non-Verbal Reasoning
syllabus.topics: Water images, Mirror images, Paper folding, Paper cutting, Embedded Figures, Dot situation, Cubes & Dice

textbooks: R. S. Aggarwal, “ Verbal and non-verbal reasoning”, Revised Edition, S Chand publication, 2017 ISBN:81-219-0551-6,
Reasoning Guru Verbal & Non-Verbal Reasoning by Vikramjeeth, Multilingual Edition-2023. ISBN :978-9358706000

course_outcomes: Develop python programs on control flow statements and strings.
Design solutions to a variety of problems using python built-in Data Structures.
Apply object-oriented concepts, error handing mechanisms in python.
Analyze and visualize using NumPy, Pandas and Matplotlib in python.

syllabus.title: Basics of Python Programming
syllabus.topics: Features, History, writing and executing first python program, Literal constants, variables and identifiers, data types, input operation, comments, reserved words, indentation, operators and expressions, expressions, Type conversion. Decision control statements: Introduction, Selection/conditional branching statements, Basic loop structures/iterative statements, Nested loops, break, continue and pass statements. Strings: Concatenating, appending and multiplying strings, immutability, String formatting operator, built-in string methods and function, slice operation.

syllabus.title: Functions, Modules, and Data Structures
syllabus.topics: Functions and Modules: Introduction, function declaration and definition, function definition, function call, variable scope and lifetime, the return statement, recursive functions, modules, packages in python. Lists: Access and update values in lists, nested and cloning lists, basic list operations, List methods, using lists as Stack and Queues, list comprehensions, loping in lists. Tuple: Creating tuple, utility of tuples, accessing values in a tuple, updating tuple, deleting elements in tuple, basic tuple operations. Sets: Creating a Set and set operations. Dictionaries: Creating a dictionary, accessing values, add, modify, delete, sort items in a dictionary, looping over a dictionary.

syllabus.title: Object-Oriented Programming and Exception Handling
syllabus.topics: Classes and Objects: Introduction, classes and objects, class method and self argument, init() method, class and object variables, del() method, other special methods, public and private data members, private methods, calling a class method from another class method, built-in class attributes, garbage collection, class and static methods, operator overloading. Inheritance: Introduction, inheriting classes in python, types of inheritance, composition/containership/complex objects, abstract classes and interfaces, Meta class. Error and Exception Handling: Introduction to errors and exceptions, handling exceptions, multiple except blocks, multiple exceptions in a single block, except block without exception, the else clause, raising exceptions, built-in and user-defined exceptions, the finally block.

syllabus.title: NumPy, Pandas, and Matplotlib
syllabus.topics: NumPy Basics: Introduction to numpy, The NumPy ndarray: A Multidimensional Array Object, Universal Functions: Fast Element-wise Array Functions. Getting Started with pandas: Introduction to Pandas Data Structures, Essential Functionalities, Summarizing and computing descriptive statistics. Plotting and Visualization: A brief Matplotlib API Primer, Plotting with Pandas and seaborn.

textbooks: ReemaThareja,“Python Programming Using Problem Solving Approach”, Oxford University Press, 2019.
Wes McKinney, “Python for Data Analysis”, Oreilly, Second Edition, 2017.
reference_books: Zed Shah, “Learn PythonThe Hard Way”, Third edition, Addison-Wesley, 2013.
Charles Severance, " Python for Informatics- Exploring Information", 1st edition Shroff Publishers, 2017.
John V. Guttag, “Introduction to Computation and Programming Using Python”, The MIT Press, 2013
W.Chun , "Core Python Programming", 2nd Edition, Prentice Hall, 2006.
Vamsi Kurama, “Python Programming, A modern approach”, Pearson, 2018.

course_outcomes: Demonstrate the divide and conquer technique with time complexity analysis
Demonstrate the divide and conquer technique with time complexity analysis
Design the algorithms for optimization problems using greedy or dynamic programming
Demonstrate backtracking technique
Perform operations on balanced data structures - AVL and B-trees
Solve scenario based problems using appropriate data structure and design technique

syllabus.title: List of Experiments
syllabus.topics: Programs on Time complexity Analysis, Divide And Conquer (Merge Sort, Quick Sort), Greedy Method (Fractional Knapsack, Prims, Kruskals, Single Source Shortest Path, Job Sequencing), Dynamic Programming (All Pairs Shortest Path, Travelling Salesperson, 0/1 Knapsack), Backtracking (N-Queens, Sum of Subsets, Graph Coloring, Hamiltonian Cycle), AVL tree operations, B-tree operations, Scenario based problem solving.

textbooks: Horowitz Sahni and Anderson-Freed, “Fundamentals of Data Structures in C”, 2nd edition, Universities Press, 2011.
Mark Allen Weiss, “Data structure and Algorithm Analysis in C”, 2nd edition, Addison Wesley Publication, 2010.

Data Structures: A Pseudocode Approach with C, 2nd Edition, R. F. Gilberg and B. A. Forouzan, Cengage Learning

course_outcomes: Design solutions to applications using object-oriented approach using Java
Implement java technology to solve runtime errors and test the correctness of programs using exception handling
Develop java applications to make use of collections frameworks and Stream API to solve real world problems
Design graphical user interface applications using Java Swings

syllabus.title: List of Experiments
syllabus.topics: Programs on primitive datatypes, classes and objects, method overloading, constructor overloading, static keyword, String and StringTokenizer, inheritance, packages, interfaces, exception handling, generic classes, multithreading, Collections Framework, Lambda Expressions, method references, Stream API, and GUI applications with Java Swings. Case studies on bank, college, library applications.

textbooks: Herbert Schildt, “Java The Complete Reference”, 11th Edition, McGraw-Hill Education, New Delhi, 2019.
reference_books: Kathy Sierra & Bert Bates, Head First Java, Second edition, Shroff/O‘Reilly, 2009
Herbert Schildt, Dale Skrien, “Java Fundamentals: A Comprehension Introduction”, Special Indian Edition, McGraw-Hill Education India Pvt. Ltd, 2013.

course_outcomes: Understand the logical inference and counting techniques
Solve problems on recurrence relations and generating functions
Infer abstract algebra and evaluate the algebraic structures
Analyze the properties, types and applications of graphs.

syllabus.title: The Foundations: Logic and Proofs, Counting Techniques
syllabus.topics: Propositional Logic, Propositional equivalences, Predicates and Quantifiers, Rules of inference, Introductions to proofs. Normal forms(PDNF, PCNF). Basics of counting, Pigeonhole principle, Generalized permutations and combinations.

syllabus.title: Advanced Counting Techniques, Relations and Functions
syllabus.topics: Recurrence Relations- Solving Linear recurrence relations-Solving homogeneous recurrence relations with constant coefficients-Solving Non homogeneous recurrence relations with constant coefficient. Relations and their Properties, functions- one to one and onto functions, equivalence relation, partial order relations, POSET and Hasse diagrams.

syllabus.title: Group Theory
syllabus.topics: Groups- definition of a group, examples and elementary properties, sub groups, group homomorphism.

syllabus.title: Graph Theory
syllabus.topics: Basic concepts, Isomorphism and sub graphs, planar graphs, Euler’s formula, Multi graphs and Euler’s circuits, Hamiltonian graphs, Grin-berg’s theorem, Graph coloring, Chromatic number

textbooks: J.L Mott and A.Kandel, Discrete Mathematics for Computer scientists and Mathematicians, 2nd edition, PHI.
N.ChandraShekharan and M.Umaparvathi , Discrete Mathematics ,PHI 2010
reference_books: Kenneth H Rosen, Discrete Mathematics and Applications, 6th edition, McGrahill
Ralph P. Grimaldi, Discrete and Combinatorial Mathematics, 4th edition(2003), Pearson education

course_outcomes: Examine Probability distributions with random variables.
Apply random phenomena of sample to test the Hypothesis concerning means.
Infer the Hypothesis concerning variance and proportions.
Examine the Quality improvement, control charts and reliability to improve Statistical skills.

syllabus.title: Probability Distributions
syllabus.topics: Random Variables (discrete and continuous), Expectation, Variance and Standard deviation of discrete random variable, Binomial distribution, Poisson distribution. Expectations, Variance and standard deviation of continuous random variables, Normal distribution, Normal approximation to the Binomial distribution. Joint distribution:Joint distributions-Discrete and Continuous.

syllabus.title: Sampling Distributions and Inferences Concerning Mean
syllabus.topics: Introduction, Populations and Samples. Inferences Concerning Mean: Point Estimation- Interval Estimation. Test of Hypothesis – Null Hypothesis and Tests of Hypothesis – Hypothesis concerning one mean – Relation between tests and Confidence intervals –Operating characteristic curves - Inferences concerning two means.

syllabus.title: Inferences Concerning Variances and Proportions
syllabus.topics: Inferences Concerning Variances: Estimation of variances- Hypothesis concerning one variance- Hypothesis concerning two variances. Inference Concerning Proportions: Estimation of Proportions- Hypothesis concerning one Proportion- Hypothesis concerning several Proportions – The Analysis of r x c Tables- Goodness of fit.

syllabus.title: Quality Improvement, Control Charts, and Reliability
syllabus.topics: The Statistical Content of Quality Improvement Programs: Quality Control- Control Charts for Measurements - Control Charts for Attributes. Applications to Reliability and Life Testing: Reliability - Failure – Time Distributions – The Exponential Model in Reliability.

textbooks: Probability and Statistics for Engineers Eighth edition by Richard A. Johnson Prentice Hall of India.
reference_books: Probability & Statistics for Engineers & Scientist by R.E. Walpole, R.H.Myers&S.L.Myers, Sixth Edition, Prentice Hall of India / Pearson Education.
Probability and Statistics, Purna Chandra Biswal, Pearson Education Prentice Hall of India 2007.
Probability and Statistics by T.K.V.Iyengar, B.Krishna Gandhi, S.Ranganatham, M.V.S.S.N.PrasadS.Chand.

course_outcomes: Outline the concepts of operating system services, Process, Multithreading, file, directory and RAID structures.
Apply Page Replacement, CPU scheduling algorithms and Disk Scheduling algorithms
Develop appropriate solutions to solve problems related to primary , secondary memory management, Inter process communication and deadlocks
Identify suitable file allocation, free space management and security measures for a given scenario

syllabus.title: Introduction, Processes, and Threads
syllabus.topics: Operating System – User View, System View, Operating System Operations, Operating-System Structure, Operating-System Services, System Calls. Process Concept: Process Concept, Process Scheduling, Operations on Processes, Inter Process Communication. Multithreaded Programming: Overview, Multicore Programming, Multi-Threading Models, Threading Issues.

syllabus.title: Process Scheduling and Synchronization
syllabus.topics: Process Scheduling: Basic Concepts, Scheduling Criteria, Scheduling Algorithms. Synchronization: Background, The Critical-Section Problem, Peterson’s Solution, Synchronization Hardware, Mutex Locks, Semaphores, Classic Problems of Synchronization.

syllabus.title: Deadlocks and Memory Management
syllabus.topics: Deadlocks: System Model, Deadlock Characterization, Methods for Handling Deadlocks, Deadlock Prevention, Deadlock Avoidance, Deadlock Detection, Recovery from Deadlock. Memory Management Strategies: Background, Swapping, Contiguous Memory Allocation, Segmentation, Paging. Virtual Memory Management: Background, Demand Paging, Copy-on-Write, Page Replacement-FIFO, LRU, OPTIMAL, Thrashing.

syllabus.title: File System, Storage, and Security
syllabus.topics: File System: File Concept, Access Methods, Directory and Disk Structure. Implementing File Systems: Allocation Methods, Free-Space Management. Mass-Storage Structure: Overview of Mass-Storage Structure, Disk Scheduling, RAID Structure. Security- Protection Goals, Access Matrix, Access Control, Revocation of Access rights.

textbooks: Abraham Silberschatz, Peter B. Galvin and Greg Gagne, “Operating System Concepts”, 9thed, John Wiley &Sons (Asia) Pvt. Ltd, 2018.
reference_books: Dhananjay M. Dhamdhere, “Operating Systems: A Concept-Based Approach”, 3rd edition, McGraw-Hill Education India Pvt. Ltd, 2017.
William Stallings, “Operating System: Internals and Design Principles”, 8thed, Prentice Hall ,2014.
Andrew S. Tanenbaum, “Modern Operating Systems”, 4th ed, Pearson , 2016.

course_outcomes: Develop schemas using data models for a given application requirement.
Construct queries using SQL and Relational algebra on a given database
Design normalized databases for a given application by incorporating various constraints and normal forms.
Analyze different forms of transactions and concurrency control mechanisms to maintain data consistency in a multi user environment.

syllabus.title: Introduction to Databases and Relational Model
syllabus.topics: Databases And Database Users: Introduction, characteristics of the database approach, actors on the scene, workers behind the scene, advantages of using the DBMS approach. Database System Concepts And Architecture: Data models, schemas, and instances, three schema architecture and data independence, Database languages and interfaces, The database system environment. Relational Data Model And Relational Database Constraints: Relational Model Concepts, Relational Model Constraints and Relational Database Schemas

syllabus.title: SQL and Relational Algebra
syllabus.topics: SQL: SQL Data Definition and Data Types, Specifying Constraints in SQL, Basic Retrieval Queries in SQL, Insert, Delete and Update Statements in SQL. More SQL: Complex Queries, Views and Schema Modification. The Relational Algebra: Unary Relational Operations: SELECT and PROJECT, Relational Algebra Operations from Set Theory, Binary Relational Operations: JOIN and DIVISION

syllabus.title: Data Modeling and Normalization
syllabus.topics: Data Modeling Using The Entity-Relationship (ER) Model: Using High-Level Conceptual Data Models for Database Design, Entity Types, Entity Sets, Attributes and Keys, Relationship types, Relationship Sets, Roles and Structural Constraints, Weak Entity Types. Database Design Theory And Methodology: Basics of Functional Dependencies and Normalization for Relational Databases - Informal Design Guidelines for Relation Schemas, Functional Dependencies, Normal forms based on Primary keys, First, Second, Third Normal Form, Boyce-Codd Normal Form, Multi valued dependency and Fourth normal form, Properties of Relational Decompositions.

syllabus.title: Transaction Processing and NoSQL Databases
syllabus.topics: Introduction to Transaction Processing Concepts And Theory : Introduction to Transaction Processing, Transaction and System Concepts, Desirable Properties of Transactions, Characterizing schedules based on Recoverability, Characterizing schedules based on Serializability. Concurrency Control Techniques: Two Phase Locking Techniques for concurrency control. NoSQL Databases : Introduction to NoSQL systems - Emergence, Characteristics, Categories. Graph Database : Introduction, High level view of graph space, The Power of Graph Databases.

textbooks: Elmasri and Navathe. “Fundamentals of Database Systems”, Ed 7. Pearson Education, 2016
Ian Robinson, Jim Webber, Emil Efriem, “Graph Databases”, OReilly Media, 2015.
reference_books: Raghurama Krishnan, Johannes Gehrke, “Database Management Systems”, 3rd Edition, TATA McGrawHill, 2008.
Silberschatz, Korth and Sudharshan. Data base System Concepts. Ed4. McGrawHill, 2009

course_outcomes: Understand the basic fundamentals of the software development life cycle.
Apply process models and testing techniques to real time applications.
Analyze requirements, specifications to build software design architecture.
Analyze the processes for identifying, assessing, and mitigating risks associated with software maintenance and evolution.

syllabus.title: Introduction to Software Engineering
syllabus.topics: Evolution, Software development projects, Exploratory style of software developments, Emergence of software engineering, Notable changes in software development practices, Computer system engineering. Software Life Cycle Models: Basic concepts, Waterfall model and its extensions, Rapid application development, Agile development model, Spiral model. Agility: Agility and the Cost of Change, Agile Process, Extreme Programming (XP), Other Agile Process Models, Tool Set for the Agile Process.

syllabus.title: Software Project Management and Requirements Analysis
syllabus.topics: Software project management complexities, Responsibilities of a software project manager, Metrics for project size estimation, Project estimation techniques, Empirical Estimation techniques, COCOMO, Halstead’s software science, risk management. Requirements Analysis And Specification: Requirements gathering and analysis, Software Requirements Specification (SRS), Formal system specification, Axiomatic specification, Algebraic specification, Executable specification and 4GL. Software Design: Overview of the design process, how to characterize a good software design? Layered arrangement of modules, Cohesion and Coupling. approaches to software design

syllabus.title: User Interface Design, Coding, and Testing
syllabus.topics: User Interface Design: Characteristics of a good user interface, Basic concepts, Types of user interfaces, Fundamentals of component-based GUI development, and user interface design methodology. Coding And Testing: Coding, Code review, Software documentation, Testing, Black-box testing, White-Box testing, Debugging, Program analysis tools, Integration testing, Testing object-oriented programs, Smoke testing, and Some general issues associated with testing. Software Reliability And Quality Management: Software reliability. Statistical testing, Software quality, Software quality management system, ISO 9000. SEI Capability maturity model. Few other important quality standards, and Six Sigma..

syllabus.title: CASE, Maintenance, and Reuse
syllabus.topics: Computer-Aided Software Engineering (Case): CASE and its scope, CASE environment, CASE support in the software life cycle, other characteristics of CASE tools, Towards second generation CASE Tool, and Architecture of a CASE Environment. Software Maintenance: Characteristics of software maintenance, Software reverse engineering, Software maintenance process models and Estimation of maintenance cost. Software Reuse: reuse- definition, introduction, reason behind no reuse so far, Basic issues in any reuse program, A reuse approach, and Reuse at organization level.

textbooks: Rajib Mall, Fundamentals of Software Engineering,-PHI Publication, 5th Edition.
Roger S. Pressman, Software Engineering A Practitioner’s Approach, Mc-Graw Hill International Edition, 9th Edition.
reference_books: Ian Sommerville, Software Engineering,10th Edition, Pearson.
Deepak Jain, Software Engineering, Principles and Practices, Oxford University Press.

Identify various ecosystem and need for biodiversity

syllabus.topics: Definition, scope and importance, Need for public awareness. Natural Resources: Renewable and Non-renewable Resources (Forest, Water, Mineral, Food, Energy, Land) - Use, over-exploitation, and conservation.

syllabus.title: Social Issues and the Environment

Design solutions to a variety of problems using python built-in Data Structures.
Apply object-oriented concepts, error handing mechanisms in python.

syllabus.title: Python libraries for web development
syllabus.topics: Collections-Container datatypes, Tkinter-GUI applications, Requests-HTTP requests, BeautifulSoup4-web scraping, Scrapy, Zappa, Dash, CherryPy, Turbo Gears, Flask, Web2Py, Bottle, Falcon, Cubic Web, Quixote, Pyramid.

syllabus.topics: Understanding Django environment, Features of Django and Django architecture, MVC and MTV, Urls and Views, Mapping the views to URLs, Django Template, Template inheritance Django Models, Creating model for site, Converting the model into a table, Fields in Models, Integrating Bootstrap into Django, Creating tables, Creating grids, Creating carousels.

syllabus.title: Integrating Accounts & Authentication and Connecting SQLite with Django
syllabus.topics: Introduction to Django Authentication System, Security Problem & Solution with Django Creating Registration Form using Django, Adding Email Field in Forms, Configuring email settings, Sending emails with Django, Adding Grid Layout On Registration Page, Adding Page Restrictions, Login Functionality Test and Logout. course_outcomes: Understand the concepts related to network categories, topologies, and reference models.
Analyze error and flow control mechanisms in data link layer
Analyse subnetting and various routing protocols of network layer
Analyze transport layer and application layer protocols for specific applications.

syllabus.title: Introduction and Physical Layer
syllabus.topics: Network Types, LAN, MAN, WAN, Network Topologies Reference models- The OSI Reference Model- the TCP/IP Reference Model- A Comparison of the OSI and TCP/IP Reference Models, OSI Vs TCP/IP. Physical Layer:Introduction to Guided Media- Twisted-pair cable, Coaxial cable and Fiber optic cable and introduction about unguided media.

syllabus.title: Data Link Layer
syllabus.topics: Design issues, Framing, flow control, error control, error detection and correction codes, CRC, Checksum. Elementary Data Link Layer protocols. Sliding window protocol: One bit, Go back N, Selective repeat-Stop and wait protocol, Data link layer in HDLC, Point to point protocol (PPP). Media Access Control: Random Access, Controlled Access, Channelization. Wired LANs: Ethernet Protocol, Standard, Fast, Gigabit, and 10 Gigabit Ethernet.

syllabus.title: Network Layer
syllabus.topics: Network Layer Design Issues, Routing Algorithms (Optimality principle, Shortest path, Flooding, Distance vector, Link state, Hierarchical), Congestion Control algorithms. Internet Working: Tunneling, internetwork routing, Fragmentation. Network layer in the internet: IP protocols, IP Version 4 protocol, IPV4 Header Format, IP addresses, Class full Addressing, CIDR, Subnets, IP Version 6, Transition from IPV4 to IPV6.

syllabus.title: Transport and Application Layers
syllabus.topics: The Transport Layer: Transport layer protocols: Introduction-services- port number-User data gram protocol-User datagram-UDP services-UDP applications. Transmission control protocol: TCP services- TCP features- Segment- A TCP connection windows in TCP- flow control-Error control, Congestion control in TCP. Application Layer: World Wide Web: HTTP, Electronic mail, TELENET, Domain Name System.

Pushdown Automata: Definition, Model, Graphical Notation, Language Acceptance, Design.

syllabus.title: Advanced Automata Theory
syllabus.topics: Deterministic and Non– Deterministic Pushdown Automata, Equivalence of Pushdown Automata and Context Free Grammars, Two Stack Pushdown Automata. Turing Machine: Definition, Model, Representation, Language of a TM, Design of TMs, Types of TMs, Church’s Thesis, Universal and Restricted TM, Decidable and Un-decidable Problems, Halting Problem of TMs, Post’s Correspondence Problem.

course_outcomes: Understand the basic concepts of compiler phases.
Apply top-down and bottom-up parsing techniques for a given grammar.

syllabus.title: Introduction to Compilers and Lexical Analysis
syllabus.topics: The structure of a compiler, a simple syntax-directed translator. Lexical Analysis: The role of the lexical analyzer, input buffering, specification of tokens, recognition of tokens, the lexical-analyzer generator Lex, finite automata, regular expressions to automata.

syllabus.title: Syntax Analysis
syllabus.topics: The role of the parser, context-free grammars, writing a grammar, top-down parsing (recursive-descent, predictive), bottom-up parsing (shift-reduce, operator precedence), introduction to LR parsing (simple LR, more powerful LR parsers), using ambiguous grammars, the parser generator Yacc.

syllabus.title: Syntax-Directed Translation and Type Checking
syllabus.topics: Syntax-directed definitions, evaluation orders for SDD's, applications of syntax-directed translation, syntax-directed translation schemes. Type Checking: Type systems, specification of a simple type checker, equivalence of type expressions, type conversions.

syllabus.topics: Intermediate languages, declarations, assignment statements, Boolean expressions, case statements, back patching, procedure calls. Code Optimization: Introduction, the principal sources of optimization, optimization of basic blocks, loops in flow graphs. Code Generation: Issues in the design of a code generator, the target language, addresses in the target code, basic blocks and flow graphs.

Benefits and challenges of cloud computing, public vs private clouds, role of virtualization in enabling the cloud; Business Agility, Storing, Managing, and Accessing Data, Performance and Scalability.

syllabus.title: Virtualization
syllabus.topics: Basics of Virtualization - Types of Virtualization - Implementation Levels of Virtualization - Virtualization Structures - Tools and Mechanisms - Virtualization of CPU, Memory, I/O Devices - Virtual Clusters and Resource management - Virtualization for Data-center Automation.

syllabus.topics: Study of Eucalyptus, Open Nebula, Open Stack, and Amazon Web Services (AWS), Google App Engine, Microsoft Azure, Force.com, and Salesforce.com. Cloud storage providers: Amazon S3, Dropbox, Google Drive.

Gautam Shroff, Enterprise Cloud Computing, Cambridge University Press, 2010.

course_outcomes: Understand the fundamental concepts of cryptography, security, and number theory.
Apply symmetric and asymmetric encryption algorithms for data confidentiality.
Apply cryptographic hash functions and digital signatures for data integrity and authentication.
Analyze real-world network security protocols and standards.

syllabus.title: Introduction and Number Theory
syllabus.topics: Security Attacks, Services, and Mechanisms. A model for network security. Number Theory: Divisibility and the division algorithm, the Euclidean algorithm, modular arithmetic, groups, rings, fields, finite fields, prime numbers, Fermat’s and Euler’s theorems, testing for primality, the Chinese remainder theorem, discrete logarithms.

syllabus.title: Symmetric and Asymmetric Cryptography
syllabus.topics: Symmetric Ciphers: Classical Encryption Techniques, block ciphers and the data encryption standard (DES), advanced encryption standard (AES). Asymmetric Ciphers: Public key cryptography, principles of public key cryptosystems, the RSA algorithm, Diffie-Hellman key exchange, Elgamal cryptographic system.

syllabus.title: Cryptographic Hash Functions and Digital Signatures
syllabus.topics: Cryptographic Hash Functions: Applications of cryptographic hash functions, secure hash algorithm (SHA). Message Authentication Codes: Message authentication requirements, functions, and codes. Digital Signatures: Digital signatures, Elgamal digital signature scheme, digital signature standard (DSS).

syllabus.title: Network Security Protocols
syllabus.topics: Web Security: Web security considerations, secure socket layer (SSL) and transport layer security (TLS). Email Security: Pretty good privacy (PGP). IP Security: IP security overview, IP security policy, encapsulating security payload (ESP). System Security: Malicious software, viruses and related threats, virus countermeasures, firewalls.

textbooks: William Stallings, Cryptography and Network Security - Principles and Practice, 7th edition, Pearson Education, 2017.
Behrouz A. Forouzan, Cryptography and Network Security, 3rd edition, McGraw-Hill, 2015.
reference_books: Atul Kahate, Cryptography and Network Security, 4th edition, McGraw-Hill, 2019.
Wenbo Mao, Modern Cryptography: Theory and Practice, 1st edition, Pearson Education, 2003.
